title: Low Priority queue unfair?

replies.body: I have not played League in a while and recently i have playing with my friends leveling their accounts up because they are new. The last game i queued up for with my friends crashed during the loading screen. When i logged back in i was put into a low priority queue. I feel that i have been wrongfully banned because i haven't played in a very long time and the first game that crashes for me, gets me banned. This system needs to be more accurate because i shouldn't get put into a low priority queue after not playing for so long, playing games consecutively as a good player, than my first technical problem gets me punished. Please help

Leaving or idling in game can mark you by [leaverbuster ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ)with a lower priority queue, regardless of the intent because it still causes everyone else a negative experience.   You will only be marked by leaverbuster after multiple games and not just one, so there may have been more situations than just a blue screen error.  The best way to overcome this is by continuing to play without any further interruptions, and test out any issues in a custom game.  If you have any technical issues I'm happy to help; otherwise, I hope that helps clear things up!

Playing without interruptions is not an option in some peoples cases because they may happen on the fly like in my game. For the past 3 games before this one game I had no ping issues no lag or anything but then for whatever reason I get 13,000 ping. If this is the only reason why someone would disconnect and they could do nothing to stop it and this happens to them over a course of a month and they still get the low priority queue punishment and then right after they play 5 games no problem and get out of the queue and then play their next game and get suspicious lag issues out of nowhere. Now I don't know about other people but league of legends is the ONLY game I get ping issues with and it is a shame because of the  effects that it has on a team when someone has to leave. So inc conclusion if I went to go test these issues in the game then there would be no problem but there is always going to be that one time when something messes up and I get banned again

.{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

Yeah, I've had that same problem, the annoying part was that I used the cmd on my other screen to make a ping test to different pages while having no connection in the game. The funniest part is that I had 50 ping to Riot servers in the cmd while the game would say I had over 10 000 ping to the game server, so it obviously was their fault. It was just once and I didn't get punished for it, but I got a warning for something they had caused.

The way the bust system works right now is crippling this game. I am about to leave this game forever just because of me getting issues over dc'd, and I can't stand wasting so much time anymore. Until riot fixes this issue, I am no longer coming back to league.
